snippet: Cigarette sales are down, but tobacco critics say the gains are being offset by the rise of alternatives like cigars, whose flavored varieties are smoked overwhelmingly by young people.
abstract: Critics of tobacco industry say Food and Drug Administration's silence on flavored cigars and other tobacco products are offsetting decline in cigarette sales spurred by 2009 law; while cigarette sales are down by a third over the past decade, cigar sales have doubled over the same period; FDA says that it plans to regulate cigars and other tobacco products, but has not said how or when.
lead_paragraph: Cigarette sales are down, but tobacco critics say the gains are being offset by the rise of alternatives like cigars, whose flavored varieties are smoked overwhelmingly by young people.

headline.main: In All Flavors, Cigars Draw In Young Smokers
headline.print_headline: In All Flavors, Cigars Draw In Young Smokers
